label: Hubble Parameter Evolution from Dynamical DE
mathematical_goal: Derive late-time H0 from dynamical dark energy correction to early-universe Planck value
theoretical_significance: The Hubble tension (67.4 vs 73.04 km/s/Mpc) is partially resolved by dynamical dark energy from G2 moduli. The correction factor (1 + k_gimel/200) ~ 1.06 boosts the early-universe value toward local measurements. PM predicts H0_late ~ 71.5 km/s/Mpc, reducing the tension to ~1.4 sigma.
